remarks: If ' Y ' is closed under the multiplication of two functions, then Y is closed under the multiplication ( ' X ' ) of a finite number of functions.  (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 20-Apr-2017.)
statement:
fmulcl.1 $e |- P = ( f e. Y , g e. Y |-> ( t e. T |-> ( ( f ` t ) x. ( g ` t ) ) ) ) $.
fmulcl.2 $e |- X = ( seq 1 ( P , U ) ` N ) $.
fmulcl.4 $e |- ( ph -> N e. ( 1 ... M ) ) $.
fmulcl.5 $e |- ( ph -> U : ( 1 ... M ) --> Y ) $.
fmulcl.6 $e |- ( ( ph /\ f e. Y /\ g e. Y ) -> ( t e. T |-> ( ( f ` t ) x. ( g ` t ) ) ) e. Y ) $.
fmulcl.7 $e |- ( ph -> T e. _V ) $.
fmulcl $p |- ( ph -> X e. Y ) $.
$d T f g t $.
$d Y f g $.
$d f g ph $.
